title: King’s Arms Tavern Salad Dressing
ingredients: ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
instructions: In a small bowl, combine the mustard, vinegar, salt, and pepper, whisking until the salt is dissolved.  Gradually pour in the oils, whisking constantly, until the dressing is thick and emulsified.  Stir in the minced garlic, oregano, tarragon, and the basil.
The dressing keeps, if tightly covered, in the refrigerator for up to one week.

Source:  The Colonial Williamsburg Tavern Cookbook, by The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation, Recipes Developed by John R. Gonzales, Edited by Charles Pierce, Clarkson Potter/Publishers, New York, © 2001 by The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation.
